body.name: Cooler Master CryoFuze Ultra-High Performance Thermal Paste, Nanoparticles, CPU/GPU Conductivity W/m.k= 14m, Non Corrosive, Temp -50°C up to 250°C for CPU and GPU Coolers (MGZ-NDSG-N07M-R2)
deliveryMessages: FREE delivery Saturday, February 17 on orders shipped by Amazon over $35
Or fastest delivery Wednesday, February 14. Order within 8 hrs 16 mins
features: High Performance: Utilizes nanoparticles for superior heat conductivity for your CPU or GPU.
Exceptional Thermal Conductivity: K value of 14W/mK handles even the most extreme system builds.
Anhygroscopic (non moisture absorbent): Electrically insulated and non-moisture absorbent properties to protect your CPU.
Easy Application: Viscously balanced formula allow for easy application and clean up.
Non Corrosive Formula: Non corrosive and oxidation resistant properties leave metal surfaces unharmed and does not solidify.
body.description: Cooler Master is launching CryoFuze, the all new line of thermal paste delivering superior bonding for your processing capabilities. Utilizing nanoparticles, CryoFuze allows for excellent thermal conductivity on all processing components for optimal heat transfer. It’s balanced viscosity and electrically insulated composition provides ultimate bonding with effortless application and clean up. The non-corrosive and oxidation resistant properties prevent solidification and leaves metal contact surfaces unharmed. CryoFuze has a versatile range of temperature performance, maintaining stability from -50°C up to 250°C.

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: Make It Yours We're all about the things that make building a PC such a rewarding experience. The sense of achievement. The joy of making and creating something uniquely yours in form and function and, of course, the thrill of bringing your creation to life without melting your components. Utilizing nanoparticles, CryoFuze allows for excellent thermal conductivity on all processing components for optimal heat transfer. The non-corrosive and oxidation resistant properties prevent solidification and leaves metal contact surfaces unharmed. Versatile range of temperature performance, maintaining stability from -50°C up to 250°C. reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 22, 2024
reviews.reviewText: This product is hard to apply, but has EXCELLENT results. I will not take any stars off for that as it does the job. The tip about heating it with hot air gun helps and makes it flow .I pasted in Rtx 3090 to begin with and it dropped the temperatures by 10 to 15° over noctua nh1.my ram got a little bit hotter but that might be new thermal pads or heat sink receiving more heat. Impressed with the results, I used it on 3080 and rx 5700 with same results.I will probably keep repasting till I run out of it. Ordering one more.Can’t comment on stability yet as it has been only a few days. The spreader is useless if you don’t heat. What has worked for me is drop a blob and gently squish it with a metal prong to get some spread. Just dropping it might work too but I did a little extra.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 14, 2024
reviews.reviewText: I bought an Asus ROG, strict desktop computer, and after three or four returns because of problems, the last time I got it, I was having overheating issues. Just on a whim I pulled the CPU cooler off and checked the CPU for temperature paste. Much to my expectations, there was none. So, instead of sending it back to Asus again, I just decided to get some and do it myself. Well, what do you know, it actually worked, and has helped keep my computer temperature to its nominal settings.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 29, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Thick, dry, effective
reviews.reviewText: I would sum it up like this: The paste is excellent in performance, but would be very difficult for someone applying the first time to successfully apply.This isn't your MX4 or MX5 -- Cryofuze Ultra is very thick and dry. If you used IC Diamond back in the day think a bit more dry than that. Spreading is nearly impossible without heating the tube a bit with a hair dryer. This gives it just enough pliability to be workable.The plus side is that due to the paste being so dry, it shouldn't have any issues with oil separation. Once it's on the temperatures are great, easily rivaling what I've seen from Kryonaut. The line method seems to be the easiest if you have a high clamping force heatsink. Otherwise spreading it is next to impossible without heating the tube up.Time will tell how long it holds up and keeps good temps. I have it running on a 4790 in a HP Z1 G2 as a test. Those tend to be a little toasty, but it's done a great job bringing the temps down from the MX4 I had on there. I'm seeing 3 - 4*c temp reductions and a much quieter fan profile. The cores now idle only slightly above room temp (19.5*c room, 24*c idle)

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 10, 2021
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Interestingly it's suppose to have a consistency of a stick of warm bubble gum...
reviews.reviewText: I've seen a lot of recent reviews of the newer 2020-21 edition of the MasterGel Maker Ultra-High Performance Thermal Compound noting that it is "dry" and therefore, defective because it is difficult to spread. To further exacerbate the issue, it also appears that there was a formulation change from the 2019 edition to the newer 2020-21 edition where the thermal paste consistency of the newer 2020-21 edition is similar to that of a stick of warm bubble gum as compared to more traditional thermal paste compounds, which are much easier to apply (e.g., Noctua NT-H1, Gelid GC-Extreme, Arctic MX-4, Artic Silver 5, etc.). But unfortunately, it appears that Cooler Master did not adequately inform their customers of this new formulation and how to best apply it.However, a quick search on another online retailer revealed that according to Cooler Master (See Newegg Reviews and Manufacturer Response on this exact same product), this paste is intended to be thick like a stick of bubble gum. So in light of that response, I gave it a try as I am optimistic that the long term performance will hold up well particularly for GPU applications. In the past, I've tried many thermal compounds on GPUs (e.g., Noctua NT-H1, Gelid GC-Extreme, Arctic MX-4) and typically, they have lasted between 6-8 months before dry out and the GPU load temperature climbs to 5 to 10 C higher than a fresh thermal paste application. So I thought perhaps Cooler Master might have the right idea here with their newer 2020-21 edition because <Roll Safe, Finger Tapping Head Meme> thermal paste can't dry out if it's dry already</Meme>.So, I applied this stick of bubble gum in a tube by: (1) squeezing out a little bit at a time, (2) pushing down on the surface to ensure what little came out stuck to the surface (e.g., surface of the GPU die), and (3) moving one-two millimeter across the surface. Steps (1)-(3) were repeated until the entire surface was covered, albeit with some moderate difficulty. Once done, this product does perform well, roughly just as well as Noctua NT-H1, Gelid GC-Extreme, and Arctic MX-4 on my overclocked MSI Duke 1070 ti (+120% Power Limit, +175 Mhz GPU, and +450 Mhz RAM OC). So far (3.5 months since application) the performance of MasterGel Maker has stayed fairly consistent, i.e., 72 to 75 C at 100% GPU load with Furmark and 60% GPU fan speed with ambient room temperature between 22-26 C. Hope this helps!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 1, 2024
Reviewed in the United States on December 25, 2023
Reviewed in the United States on December 23, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Very low core temps. Used for several months on 4090 waterblock and 13900KF
reviews.reviewText: After months this paste is still holding up. My temps are great with this paste.I cleaned off the paste that came with my 4090's waterblock and used this instead. I will admit spreading it manually for that portion was a challenge.For the CPU it was very easy

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 2, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Slightly strange texture, not very easy to spread with the included applicator, but good thermals.
reviews.reviewText: It was slightly strange applying this thermal paste as it seemed quite a bit thicker and more viscous than paste I've used in the past. I ended up using an x pattern because I wasn't sure about how this paste would spread. Despite this, my thermal performance has been quite good. At the end of the day the thermal paste you use doesn't make a big difference in performance but this has been running my Ryzen 5 5600 with a Hyper 212 black a little bit cooler than it did before I had changed the paste. At idle I get roughly 38 degrees C. Great price, slightly cheaper than most other well-known alternatives so that was a plus.
Es una pasta de buena calidad, la uso para darle mantenimiento a los equipos si baja la temperatura de los componentes

reviews.reviewTitle: Buena calidad por un bajo precio
reviews.reviewText: La pasta viene con todo lo necesario para instalarla, es muy facil y rapido, yo la usé en una laptop Asus y las temperaturas bajaron bastante, lamentablemente no ejecuté pruebas de temperatura rigurosas sin embargo el cambio fue notorio, tanto a nivel de ruido como a nivel de sensacion termica en el teclado (antes si se notaban algunas teclas calientes, despues de la aplicación ese problema quedó resuelto), tiene una consistencia suficientemente buena para manejarla sin mayor problema, la jeringa ofrece suficiente contenido para unas 3 aplicaciones en laptop (el procesador puede llegar a ser más pequeño, por eso)
Pesem num pasta top de mas botei na rtx3080 do ali é abaixou 7 graus recomendo
Cumpri perfeitamente o seu objetivo. Gostei do produto.
